title: What is the oldest unchanged constitution? - Quora

response.answer_text: From a bit of online research, the oldest two that I've found were:  Japan. The current constitution has not been amended since adoption in 1947. [1]Denmark. Denmark has no means for its constitutions to be amended; it can only be replaced with a new constitution, and this was last done in 1953. [2]Other candidates that came up in searches included Uruguay, Italy, and Ireland, but all of these have been amended at least a decade more recently. [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_japan [2] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Denmark
